intro: Peucedanum palustre, commonly known as marsh cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils and can be found in marshes, fens, and along the edges of water bodies. Its slender stems bear small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are finely divided and often have a distinctive, slightly bitter scent.
